name: Displacement
description: The shortest distance from the initial to the final position of a point.

name: Velocity (Average)
description: The rate at which an object changes its position.

name: Acceleration (Average)
description: The rate at which an object changes its velocity.

name: Newton's Second Law of Motion
description: The acceleration of an object is directly proportional to the net force acting on it and inversely proportional to its mass.

name: Weight
description: The force exerted on an object due to gravity.

name: Kinetic Energy
description: The energy possessed by an object due to its motion.

name: Gravitational Potential Energy
description: The energy an object possesses due to its position in a gravitational field.

name: Work Done by a Constant Force
description: The energy transferred to or from an object by a force acting over a displacement.

name: Power
description: The rate at which work is done or energy is transferred.

name: Momentum
description: A measure of the mass in motion of an object.

name: Impulse
description: The change in momentum of an object.

name: Density
description: Mass per unit volume of a substance.

name: Pressure
description: Force applied perpendicular to the surface of an object per unit area over which that force is distributed.

name: Hooke's Law (Spring Force)
description: The force required to extend or compress a spring is directly proportional to the distance of that extension or compression.

name: Period of a Simple Pendulum
description: The time taken for one complete oscillation of a simple pendulum.

name: Frequency
description: The number of cycles or oscillations per unit time.

name: Wave Speed
description: The speed at which a wave travels through a medium.

name: Ohm's Law
description: The current through a conductor between two points is directly proportional to the voltage across the two points.

name: Electric Power
description: The rate at which electrical energy is transferred.

name: Capacitance
description: The ability of a system to store an electric charge.

name: Energy Stored in a Capacitor
description: The electrical potential energy stored in the electric field of a capacitor.

name: Heat Transfer (Conduction)
description: The transfer of thermal energy between objects in direct contact.

name: Specific Heat Capacity
description: The amount of heat required to raise the temperature of one unit mass of a substance by one degree Celsius or Kelvin.

name: Ideal Gas Law
description: Relates pressure, volume, temperature, and the number of moles of an ideal gas.

name: Refraction (Snell's Law)
description: Describes the relationship between the angles of incidence and refraction, when light passes through a boundary between two different isotropic media.

name: Lens Equation (Thin Lens)
description: Relates the focal length of a lens to the distances of the object and image from the lens.

name: Magnification (Thin Lens)
description: The ratio of the image height to the object height.

name: Doppler Effect (Sound)
description: The change in frequency or wavelength of a wave in relation to an observer who is moving relative to the wave source.

name: Sound Intensity
description: The power carried by sound waves per unit area in a direction perpendicular to that area.

name: Sound Intensity Level (Decibels)
description: A logarithmic measure of the sound intensity relative to a reference intensity.

name: Kinematic Equation 1 (Constant Acceleration)
description: Relates final velocity, initial velocity, acceleration, and time.

name: Kinematic Equation 2 (Constant Acceleration)
description: Relates displacement, initial velocity, final velocity, and time.

name: Kinematic Equation 3 (Constant Acceleration)
description: Relates final velocity, initial velocity, acceleration, and displacement.

name: Kinematic Equation 4 (Constant Acceleration)
description: Relates displacement, initial velocity, acceleration, and time.

name: Newton's First Law of Motion
description: An object at rest stays at rest and an object in motion stays in motion with the same speed and in the same direction unless acted upon by an unbalanced force.

name: Newton's Third Law of Motion
description: For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.

name: Gravitational Force (Universal)
description: The attractive force between any two masses.

name: Elastic Potential Energy (Spring)
description: The energy stored in a spring when it is stretched or compressed.

name: Power (Force and Velocity)
description: The rate at which work is done by a force moving an object.

name: Angular Velocity
description: The rate of change of angular displacement.

name: Angular Acceleration
description: The rate of change of angular velocity.

name: Torque
description: A twisting force that tends to cause rotation.

name: Moment of Inertia (Point Mass)
description: A measure of an object's resistance to changes in its rotation for a point mass.

name: Angular Momentum
description: The rotational equivalent of linear momentum.

name: Rotational Kinetic Energy
description: The kinetic energy an object possesses due to its rotation.

name: Centripetal Acceleration
description: The acceleration directed towards the center of a circular path.

name: Centripetal Force
description: The force required to keep an object moving in a circular path.

name: Period of a Mass-Spring System
description: The time taken for one complete oscillation of a mass attached to a spring.

name: Coulomb's Law
description: Quantifies the force between two point charges.

name: Electric Field (Point Charge)
description: The electric field strength produced by a point charge.
units: Newtons per Coulomb (N/C) or Volts per meter (V/m)

name: Electric Potential (Point Charge)
description: The electric potential at a distance from a point charge.

name: Magnetic Force on a Moving Charge (Lorentz Force)
description: The force exerted by a magnetic field on a moving electric charge.

name: Magnetic Force on a Current-Carrying Wire
description: The force exerted by a magnetic field on a current-carrying wire.

name: Magnetic Flux
description: A measure of the total magnetic field passing through a given area.

name: Faraday's Law of Induction
description: States that a time-varying magnetic field produces an electric field (induced EMF).

name: Motional EMF
description: The electromotive force induced across a conductor moving through a magnetic field.

name: Internal Energy Change (First Law of Thermodynamics)
description: The change in internal energy of a system, related to heat and work.

name: Work Done by Gas (Constant Pressure)
description: The work done by a gas expanding against a constant external pressure.

name: Enthalpy Change (Constant Pressure)
description: The heat change of a system at constant pressure.

name: Entropy Change (Reversible Process)
description: The change in disorder for a reversible heat flow at constant temperature.

name: Gibbs Free Energy Change
description: Predicts the spontaneity of a process at constant temperature and pressure.

name: Wave Equation (1D)
description: Describes the propagation of a one-dimensional wave.

name: Intensity (Spherical Wave)
description: The power per unit area carried by a spherical wave.

name: Constructive Interference (Double Slit)
description: Condition for bright fringes in a double-slit experiment.

name: Destructive Interference (Double Slit)
description: Condition for dark fringes in a double-slit experiment.

name: Single Slit Diffraction (Minima)
description: Condition for dark fringes in a single-slit diffraction pattern.

name: Standing Waves on a String (Wavelength)
description: Wavelengths for standing waves on a string with fixed ends.

name: Standing Waves on a String (Frequency)
description: Frequencies for standing waves on a string with fixed ends.

name: Stress (Normal)
description: The internal force per unit area acting perpendicular to a surface within a material.

name: Strain (Normal)
description: The deformation of a material in response to an applied force, expressed as the change in length per unit original length.

name: Young's Modulus (Modulus of Elasticity)
description: A measure of the stiffness of an elastic material, defined as the ratio of stress to strain.

name: Shear Stress
description: The internal force per unit area acting parallel to a surface within a material.

name: Shear Strain
description: The angular deformation of a material due to shear stress.

name: Shear Modulus (Modulus of Rigidity)
description: A measure of the resistance to shear deformation.

name: Bulk Modulus
description: A measure of a fluid's or solid's resistance to compression.

name: Bernoulli's Principle
description: States that for an incompressible, inviscid fluid in steady flow, an increase in the speed of the fluid occurs simultaneously with a decrease in pressure or a decrease in the fluid's potential energy.

name: Continuity Equation (Fluid Dynamics)
description: States that for an incompressible fluid, the mass flow rate must remain constant along a streamline.

name: Volumetric Flow Rate
description: The volume of fluid passing through a given cross-sectional area per unit time.

name: Reynolds Number
description: A dimensionless quantity used to predict flow patterns in different fluid flow situations.

name: Heat Transfer (Convection)
description: The transfer of heat by the movement of a fluid.

name: Heat Transfer (Radiation - Stefan-Boltzmann Law)
description: The total energy radiated per unit surface area of a black body across all wavelengths per unit time is directly proportional to the fourth power of the black body's thermodynamic temperature.

name: Thermal Resistance (Conduction)
description: A measure of a material's ability to resist the flow of heat.

name: Coefficient of Thermal Expansion (Linear)
description: The fractional change in length per unit change in temperature.

name: Mechanical Advantage
description: The ratio of the output force to the input force in a machine.

name: Efficiency
description: The ratio of useful energy output to total energy input, often expressed as a percentage.

name: Resistors in Series
description: The total resistance of resistors connected in series is the sum of their individual resistances.

name: Resistors in Parallel
description: The reciprocal of the total resistance of resistors connected in parallel is the sum of the reciprocals of their individual resistances.

name: Capacitors in Series
description: The reciprocal of the total capacitance of capacitors connected in series is the sum of the reciprocals of their individual capacitances.

name: Capacitors in Parallel
description: The total capacitance of capacitors connected in parallel is the sum of their individual capacitances.

name: Inductance
description: The property of an electrical conductor by which a change in current through it induces an electromotive force (voltage) in both the conductor itself and in any nearby conductors.

name: Energy Stored in an Inductor
description: The energy stored in the magnetic field of an inductor.

name: RC Circuit Time Constant
description: The time required for the voltage across the capacitor to reach approximately 63.2% of its maximum value during charging or to fall to 36.8% during discharging.

name: RL Circuit Time Constant
description: The time required for the current in the inductor to reach approximately 63.2% of its maximum value during charging or to fall to 36.8% during discharging.

name: Resonance Frequency (RLC Circuit)
description: The frequency at which the inductive and capacitive reactances in an RLC circuit cancel each other out, leading to maximum current.

name: Coefficient of Performance (COP) - Heat Pump
description: A measure of the efficiency of a heat pump, defined as the ratio of heat delivered to the work input.

name: Coefficient of Performance (COP) - Refrigerator
description: A measure of the efficiency of a refrigerator, defined as the ratio of heat removed from the cold reservoir to the work input.

name: Specific Impulse (Rocketry)
description: A measure of the efficiency of a rocket engine, representing the thrust per unit mass flow rate of propellant.

name: Thrust (Rocketry)
description: The force that propels a rocket, generated by the expulsion of high-velocity exhaust gases.

name: D'Alembert's Principle
description: States that the sum of the differences between the forces acting on a system of particles and the time derivatives of the momenta of the particles along any virtual displacement is zero.

name: Euler-Bernoulli Beam Equation
description: Describes the relationship between the beam's deflection and the applied load.

name: Torsion Equation (Shaft)
description: Relates the applied torque to the shear stress and angle of twist in a circular shaft.

name: Critical Buckling Load (Euler's Formula)
description: The maximum axial compressive force that a slender column can withstand without buckling.

name: Heat Engine Efficiency (Carnot)
description: The maximum possible efficiency for a heat engine operating between two temperatures.

name: Coefficient of Drag
description: A dimensionless quantity that is used to quantify the drag or resistance of an object in a fluid environment.

name: Coefficient of Lift
description: A dimensionless quantity that relates the lift generated by a lifting body to the fluid density, velocity, and reference area.

name: Flow Rate (Hagen-Poiseuille Equation)
description: Describes the pressure drop in an incompressible Newtonian fluid flowing in a laminar flow through a long cylindrical pipe of constant circular cross-section.

name: Hydrostatic Pressure
description: The pressure exerted by a fluid at equilibrium at a given point within the fluid, due to the force of gravity.

name: Torque
description: A twisting force that tends to cause rotation.

name: Moment of Inertia
description: A measure of an object's resistance to changes in its rotation.

name: Angular Momentum
description: The rotational equivalent of linear momentum.

name: Rotational Kinetic Energy
description: The kinetic energy an object possesses due to its rotation.

name: Stress-Strain Curve (Yield Strength)
description: The stress at which a material begins to deform plastically.

name: Stress-Strain Curve (Ultimate Tensile Strength)
description: The maximum stress a material can withstand while being stretched or pulled before breaking.

name: Poisson's Ratio
description: The ratio of transverse strain to axial strain.

name: Thermal Conductivity
description: A material's ability to conduct heat.

name: Convection Heat Transfer Coefficient
description: A measure of the rate of heat transfer by convection between a surface and a fluid.

name: Radiation Emissivity
description: A measure of a material's ability to emit thermal radiation.

name: Electrical Resistivity
description: A measure of how strongly a material opposes the flow of electric current.

name: Electrical Conductivity
description: A measure of a material's ability to conduct electric current.

name: Inductive Reactance
description: The opposition of an inductor to a change in current, measured in ohms.

name: Capacitive Reactance
description: The opposition of a capacitor to a change in voltage, measured in ohms.

name: Impedance (Series RLC)
description: The total opposition to current flow in an AC circuit, combining resistance and reactance.

name: Power Factor (AC Circuit)
description: The ratio of the real power flowing to the load to the apparent power in the circuit.

name: Mean Free Path (Gas Dynamics)
description: The average distance a particle (e.g., atom, molecule, photon) travels between successive collisions with other particles.

name: Viscosity (Dynamic)
description: A measure of a fluid's resistance to flow.

name: Kinematic Viscosity
description: The ratio of the dynamic viscosity to the density of the fluid.

name: Surface Tension
description: The cohesive forces between liquid molecules at the surface that cause the surface to behave like an elastic sheet.

name: Mass Flow Rate
description: The rate at which mass flows through a system.

name: Froude Number
description: Compares inertial forces to gravitational forces, useful for open channel flow.

name: Darcy-Weisbach Equation (Head Loss)
description: Calculates head loss due to friction in a pipe.

name: Manning's Equation (Open Channel Flow)
description: Estimates flow rate in open channels based on channel shape and roughness.

name: Orifice Equation (Flow Rate)
description: Calculates flow rate through an orifice based on pressure difference.

name: Weir Flow Equation
description: Determines flow rate over a weir based on the height of the water above the weir crest.

name: Mohr-Coulomb Failure Criterion (Soil Strength)
description: Describes the shear strength of soils.

name: Terzaghi's 1D Consolidation Theory (Differential Equation)
description: Describes time-dependent settlement of saturated cohesive soils.

name: Coefficient of Consolidation (Soil)
description: Indicates combined effects of permeability and compressibility of soil.

name: Stress Concentration Factor
description: Quantifies the increase in stress around geometric discontinuities.

name: Effective Stress Concentration Factor
description: Accounts for notch sensitivity in stress concentration.

name: Newton's Law of Cooling
description: The rate of temperature change of an object is proportional to the temperature difference between the object and its surroundings.

name: Heat Engine Efficiency (General)
description: The ratio of net work output to heat input for a heat engine.

name: Rankine Cycle Thermal Efficiency
description: Efficiency of an ideal vapor power plant cycle.

name: Brayton Cycle Efficiency (Ideal)
description: Efficiency of an ideal gas turbine cycle.

name: Galilean Transformation (Position)
description: How position transforms between inertial frames.

name: Galilean Transformation (Velocity)
description: How velocity transforms between inertial frames.

name: Coriolis Force
description: A fictitious force arising in rotating reference frames, causing deflection perpendicular to velocity.

name: Lagrangian
description: Difference between kinetic and potential energy, central to Lagrangian mechanics.

name: Action (Hamilton's Principal Function)
description: Time integral of the Lagrangian, minimized by the system's path.

name: Euler-Lagrange Equation
description: Yields equations of motion from the Lagrangian.

name: Hamiltonian
description: Total energy of a system in Hamiltonian mechanics.

name: Hamilton's Equations (Position)
description: One of Hamilton's canonical equations.

name: Hamilton's Equations (Momentum)
description: One of Hamilton's canonical equations.

name: Electric Current Density (Convection)
description: Current per unit area due to moving charges.

name: Electric Current Density (Displacement)
description: Current per unit area arising from changing electric displacement fields.

name: Electric Displacement Field
description: Related to electric field and polarization of the medium.

name: Magnetic Field from Vector Potential
description: Magnetic field derived from its vector potential.

name: Gauss's Law for Electricity (Differential Form)
description: Relates electric displacement field to free charge density.

name: Gauss's Law for Magnetism (Differential Form)
description: States there are no magnetic monopoles.

name: Faraday's Law of Induction (Differential Form)
description: Time-varying magnetic field produces an electric field.

name: Ampere-Maxwell Law (Differential Form)
description: Magnetic fields generated by electric currents and time-varying electric fields.

name: Resistors in Series (Total Resistance)
description: The total resistance of resistors connected in series is the sum of their individual resistances.

name: Resistors in Parallel (Total Resistance)
description: The reciprocal of the total resistance of resistors connected in parallel is the sum of the reciprocals of their individual resistances.

name: Capacitors in Series (Total Capacitance)
description: The reciprocal of the total capacitance of capacitors connected in series is the sum of the reciprocals of their individual capacitances.

name: Capacitors in Parallel (Total Capacitance)
description: The total capacitance of capacitors connected in parallel is the sum of their individual capacitances.

name: Inductors in Series (Total Inductance)
description: The total inductance of inductors connected in series is the sum of their individual inductances.

name: Inductors in Parallel (Total Inductance)
description: The reciprocal of the total inductance of inductors connected in parallel is the sum of the reciprocals of their individual inductances.

name: RC Circuit (Charging Capacitor Charge)
description: Charge on a capacitor in an RC circuit during charging.

name: RC Circuit (Discharging Capacitor Charge)
description: Charge on a capacitor in an RC circuit during discharging.

name: RL Circuit (Rising Inductor Current)
description: Current through an inductor in an RL circuit during current rise.

name: RL Circuit (Falling Inductor Current)
description: Current through an inductor in an RL circuit during current fall.

name: LC Circuit Resonance Frequency
description: The natural oscillation frequency of an LC circuit.

name: RCL Circuit Damping Factor
description: Characterizes the damping in an RLC circuit.

name: RCL Circuit Resonant Frequency (Damped)
description: The resonant frequency of a damped RLC circuit.

name: Thevenin Equivalent Voltage
description: The open-circuit voltage across the load terminals in a linear circuit.

name: Thevenin Equivalent Resistance
description: The equivalent resistance looking back into the circuit with independent sources turned off.

name: Norton Equivalent Current
description: The short-circuit current through the load terminals in a linear circuit.

name: Norton Equivalent Resistance
description: The equivalent resistance looking back into the circuit with independent sources turned off.

name: Permeability (Magnetic Materials)
description: Ease with which a magnetic flux is established within a material.

name: Clapeyron Equation (Phase Transition)
description: Relates vapor pressure and temperature during a phase transition.

name: Beam Deflection (Simply Supported, Center Load)
description: Maximum deflection of a simply supported beam with a point load at its center.

name: Euler's Column Formula (Pinned-Pinned)
description: Critical buckling load for a pinned-pinned slender column.

name: Euler's Column Formula (Fixed-Free)
description: Critical buckling load for a fixed-free slender column.

name: Euler's Column Formula (Fixed-Fixed)
description: Critical buckling load for a fixed-fixed slender column.

name: Euler's Column Formula (Fixed-Pinned)
description: Critical buckling load for a fixed-pinned slender column.

name: Critical Buckling Stress
description: The stress at which a slender column will buckle.

name: Fatigue Life (S-N Curve)
description: Relates nominal stress range to number of cycles to failure.

name: Goodman Criterion (Mean Stress Correction)
description: Used to account for the effect of mean stress on fatigue life.

name: Soderberg Criterion (Mean Stress Correction)
description: A more conservative criterion for mean stress correction in fatigue.

name: Blood Flow Rate (Poiseuille's Law - simplified)
description: Describes the flow of viscous fluid through a cylindrical tube, applicable to blood vessels.

name: Diffusion (Fick's First Law)
description: Describes the rate of diffusion of a substance across a membrane or through a medium.
units: moles per square meter per second (mol/m²·s)

name: Osmotic Pressure (van 't Hoff equation)
description: The pressure that needs to be applied to a solution to prevent the inward flow of water across a semipermeable membrane.

name: Lever System (Mechanical Advantage in Biomechanics)
description: The ratio of the output force to the input force in a biological lever system (e.g., muscle and bone).

name: Work Done by Muscle
description: The work performed by a muscle contracting against a load.

name: Power Output of Muscle
description: The rate at which a muscle performs work.

name: Hydrostatic Pressure (in body fluids)
description: Pressure exerted by fluids within the body, such as blood pressure or interstitial fluid pressure.

name: Surface Area to Volume Ratio
description: The ratio of the surface area of an organism or cell to its volume, critical for processes like heat exchange and nutrient absorption.

name: Lens Power (Diopters)
description: A measure of the refractive power of a lens, used in optics of the eye.

name: Acoustic Impedance (in biological tissues)
description: A measure of the resistance of a medium to the propagation of sound waves, relevant in ultrasound imaging.

name: Flow Resistance (Blood Vessels)
description: The resistance to blood flow through a vessel, influenced by vessel length, radius, and blood viscosity.
units: Pascals per cubic meter per second (Pa·s/m³)

name: Cardiac Output
description: The volume of blood pumped by the heart per unit time.

name: Blood Pressure (Mean Arterial Pressure)
description: The average arterial pressure during a single cardiac cycle.

name: Reynolds Number (Blood Flow)
description: Used to predict turbulent flow in blood vessels, which can indicate pathological conditions.

name: Elasticity (Arterial Walls)
description: The ability of arterial walls to stretch and recoil, influencing blood pressure and flow.

name: Heat Loss by Evaporation
description: The loss of heat from the body due to the evaporation of sweat.

name: Basal Metabolic Rate (BMR)
description: The rate at which the body expends energy at rest to maintain vital functions.
formula: $$\text{Various empirical formulas exist, e.g., Mifflin-St Jeor Equation}$$

name: Force of Muscle Contraction
description: The force generated by a muscle, dependent on factors like muscle cross-sectional area and activation level.

name: Joint Torque
description: The rotational force around a joint, produced by muscles acting on bones.

name: Center of Mass (Human Body)
description: The average position of all the mass in the human body, crucial for balance and movement.

name: Pressure in Alveoli (Laplace's Law)
description: Relates the pressure inside a spherical bubble or alveolus to the surface tension and radius.

name: Sound Attenuation in Tissue
description: The reduction in sound intensity as it travels through biological tissue.

name: Light Absorption (Beer-Lambert Law)
description: Relates the attenuation of light to the properties of the material through which the light is traveling.

name: Heat Transfer in Body (Conduction)
description: Heat transfer within the body or between the body and surfaces in contact.

name: Heat Transfer in Body (Convection)
description: Heat transfer between the body surface and surrounding air or water.

name: Heat Transfer in Body (Radiation)
description: Heat exchange between the body and its surroundings through electromagnetic waves.

name: Blood Viscosity
description: A measure of the resistance of blood to flow, influenced by red blood cell concentration and plasma proteins.

name: Compliance (Blood Vessels/Lungs)
description: A measure of the distensibility of a structure, i.e., how easily it stretches.

name: Ventilation Rate (Respiratory Physics)
description: The volume of air inhaled or exhaled per minute.

name: Work of Breathing
description: The energy expended by the respiratory muscles to move air in and out of the lungs.

name: Diffusion Coefficient (Biological Systems)
description: A proportionality constant in Fick's laws that relates the molar flux due to diffusion to the concentration gradient.

name: Nernst Equation (Membrane Potential)
description: Calculates the equilibrium potential for an ion across a membrane, based on its concentration gradient.

name: Goldman-Hodgkin-Katz Voltage Equation (Resting Membrane Potential)
description: Calculates the resting membrane potential across a cell membrane, considering multiple ions.

name: Action Potential Propagation Speed
description: The speed at which an action potential travels along an axon.

name: Muscle Force-Velocity Relationship (Hill's Equation)
description: Describes the inverse relationship between the force a muscle can generate and its shortening velocity.

name: Muscle Length-Tension Relationship
description: Describes how the force a muscle can generate depends on its length.

name: Bone Stress
description: The internal force per unit area within bone tissue due to applied loads.

name: Bone Strain
description: The deformation of bone tissue in response to stress.

name: Young's Modulus (Bone)
description: A measure of bone stiffness.

name: Joint Reaction Force
description: The force exerted by one bone segment on another at a joint.

name: Ground Reaction Force (Biomechanics)
description: The force exerted by the ground on a body in contact with it.

name: Angular Velocity (Limb Movement)
description: The rate of change of angular position of a limb or body segment.

name: Angular Acceleration (Limb Movement)
description: The rate of change of angular velocity of a limb or body segment.

name: Rotational Inertia (Limb)
description: A measure of a limb's resistance to changes in its rotational motion.

name: Momentum (Human Movement)
description: The product of mass and velocity of the entire body or a body segment.

name: Impulse (Human Movement)
description: The change in momentum of the body or a body segment.

name: Collagen Elasticity (Connective Tissue)
description: The ability of collagen fibers in connective tissues to stretch and return to their original shape.

name: Air Resistance (Sport)
description: The drag force exerted by air on a moving object or athlete.

name: Buoyancy Force (Swimming)
description: The upward force exerted by a fluid that opposes the weight of an immersed object.

name: Metabolic Equivalent of Task (MET)
description: A physiological measure expressing the energy cost of physical activities.

name: Oxygen Consumption Rate (VO2)
description: The rate at which oxygen is consumed by the body, indicating metabolic activity.

name: Work-Energy Theorem (Sport)
description: The net work done on an object is equal to the change in its kinetic energy.

name: Conservation of Momentum (Collisions in Sport)
description: In the absence of external forces, the total momentum of a system remains constant.

name: Projectile Motion (Vertical Displacement)
description: Vertical displacement of an object thrown or projected into the air.

name: Range of Projectile (Sport)
description: The horizontal distance traveled by a projectile.

name: Peak Height of Projectile (Sport)
description: The maximum vertical displacement reached by a projectile.

name: Friction (Sport)
description: The force resisting the relative motion of solid surfaces, fluid layers, and material elements sliding against each other.

name: Coefficient of Restitution (Collisions in Sport)
description: A measure of the 'bounciness' of a collision.

name: Stokes-Einstein Relation (Diffusion)
description: Connects the diffusion constant of a particle to thermal energy and fluid drag.

name: Bjerrum Length (Electrostatics in Biology)
description: Distance at which electrostatic energy equals thermal energy in a medium.

name: Debye-Hückel Length (Screened Electrostatics)
description: Describes the exponential decay of screened electrostatic interactions in an electrolyte solution.

name: Elastic Energy of a Filament (Bending)
description: The energy stored in a filament due to bending.

name: Persistence Length (Filament Stiffness)
description: A measure of a filament's stiffness, indicating the length over which it remains rigid.

name: Euler Buckling Critical Force (Filament)
description: The compressive force at which an elastic filament will buckle.

name: Mean Squared End-to-End Displacement (Random Walk Polymer)
description: Mean squared distance between the ends of a random walk polymer.

name: Hookean Spring Constant (Entropic Spring)
description: Spring constant for a polymer where elasticity arises from entropy.

name: Joint Power (Biomechanics)
description: The rate at which work is done by muscles and tendons around a joint.

name: Muscle Moment Arm
description: How effectively a muscle's contraction force can generate torque about a joint.

name: Aerodynamic Drag Area (Cycling)
description: Combines drag coefficient and frontal area for aerodynamic drag.

name: Hydrodynamic Drag (Swimming)
description: The force water exerts on the swimmer, reducing forward displacement.

name: Van der Waals Interaction Potential
description: Describes attractive force between neutral atoms/molecules.

name: Total Interaction Energy (DLVO Theory)
description: Combines van der Waals attraction and screened electrostatic repulsion between membranes.

name: Vesicle Fluctuation Elastic Energy (Spherical Harmonics)
description: Elastic energy of vesicle fluctuations described by spherical harmonics.

name: Fluctuation-Induced Repulsion (Helfrich Repulsion)
description: Repulsive pressure between two elastic membranes due to thermal fluctuations.

name: Molecular Motor Stepping Velocity
description: Velocity of a molecular motor related to its ATP hydrolysis rate.

name: VO2 Max (Fick Equation)
description: Maximum rate of oxygen consumption, a measure of aerobic capacity.

name: Respiratory Quotient (RQ)
description: Ratio of carbon dioxide produced to oxygen consumed, indicating fuel source.

name: Heart Rate Max (Estimated)
description: Estimated maximum heart rate for an individual.

name: Target Heart Rate (Karvonen Formula)
description: Calculates target heart rate for exercise based on desired intensity.

name: Lactate Threshold
description: Exercise intensity at which lactate begins to accumulate in the blood.

name: Rate of Perceived Exertion (RPE)
description: Subjective measure of exercise intensity.

name: Work-to-Rest Ratio
description: Ratio of work duration to rest duration in interval training.

name: Training Load (TRIMP)
description: Quantifies the physiological stress of a training session.

name: Efficiency of Movement (Gross Efficiency)
description: Ratio of mechanical power output to metabolic power input.

name: Running Economy
description: Oxygen cost of running at a given speed.

name: Jump Height (from Flight Time)
description: Calculates jump height based on the time spent in the air.

name: Vertical Jump Power (Lewis Formula)
description: Estimates power during a vertical jump.

name: Balance (Center of Pressure Excursion)
description: Measures the displacement of the center of pressure during standing or movement.

name: Stability Limits (Base of Support)
description: The maximum angle of lean before losing balance.
formula: $$\theta_{max} = \arctan\left(\frac{\text{Distance to Edge of BOS}}{\text{Height of COM}}\right)$$

name: Impact Force (Landing)
description: Force experienced during a landing or impact.

name: Shock Absorption (Damping Coefficient)
description: A measure of a material's ability to dissipate energy during impact.

name: Muscle Fiber Type Distribution
description: Proportion of slow-twitch (Type I) vs. fast-twitch (Type II) muscle fibers.

name: Electromyography (EMG) Amplitude
description: Measures the electrical activity of muscles, indicating muscle activation level.
formula: $$\text{RMS (Root Mean Square) or Average Rectified Value}$$

name: Muscle Fatigue Index
description: Quantifies the decline in muscle force or power over time during sustained activity.
formula: $$\text{Various indices, e.g., (Initial Power - Final Power) / Initial Power}$$

name: Heat Production (Metabolic Rate)
description: Rate at which the body generates heat from metabolic processes.

name: Convective Heat Loss (Body)
description: Heat loss from the body surface to the surrounding air/water.

name: Radiative Heat Loss (Body)
description: Heat loss from the body via infrared radiation.

name: Evaporative Heat Loss (Body)
description: Heat loss due to the evaporation of sweat.

name: Total Heat Loss (Body)
description: Sum of all heat loss mechanisms from the body.

name: Thermal Comfort Index (PMV)
description: Predicts the mean vote of a large group of people on a thermal sensation scale.
formula: $$\text{Complex empirical model, not a simple formula}$$

name: Effective Temperature
description: A single temperature that combines the effects of air temperature, humidity, and air movement on thermal comfort.

name: Cardiac Drift
description: Gradual increase in heart rate during prolonged exercise despite constant intensity.

name: Rate of Force Development (RFD)
description: The rate at which a muscle can generate force.

name: Stretch-Shortening Cycle (SSC) Efficiency
description: Measure of how effectively elastic energy is utilized in movements involving eccentric-concentric muscle actions.
formula: $$\text{Ratio of work output to work input, or jump height difference}$$

name: Joint Stiffness (Angular)
description: Resistance of a joint to angular deformation.

name: Bone Mineral Density (BMD)
description: Measure of bone strength and density.
formula: $$\text{Measured by DXA scan, no simple formula}$$

name: Stress Fracture Risk (Bone Load)
description: Risk assessment based on cumulative bone loading.
formula: $$\text{Complex models, often involving fatigue life concepts}$$

name: Muscle Cross-Sectional Area (CSA)
description: Area of muscle perpendicular to its fibers, related to force production.

name: Muscle Pennation Angle
description: Angle at which muscle fibers are oriented relative to the muscle's line of action.

name: Muscle Fascicle Length
description: Length of individual muscle fascicles, related to muscle shortening velocity.

name: Electromyography (EMG) Frequency Analysis (MDF)
description: Mean or median frequency of the EMG signal, often used as a fatigue indicator.

name: Joint Contact Area
description: Area over which two joint surfaces are in contact, influencing pressure distribution.

name: Joint Contact Pressure
description: Pressure exerted between joint surfaces.

name: Ligament/Tendon Strain
description: Deformation of ligaments or tendons under load.

name: Ligament/Tendon Stress
description: Internal force per unit area within ligaments or tendons.

name: Tissue Viscoelasticity (Stress Relaxation)
description: Decrease in stress over time in a material held at constant strain.

name: Tissue Viscoelasticity (Creep)
description: Increase in strain over time in a material held at constant stress.

name: Collagen Fiber Orientation
description: Alignment of collagen fibers within connective tissue, influencing mechanical properties.

name: Muscle Activation Dynamics
description: Temporal response of muscle force production to neural stimulation.
formula: $$\text{Modeled by differential equations, e.g., first-order kinetics}$$

name: Motor Unit Recruitment
description: The process by which more motor units are activated to increase muscle force.

name: Proprioception (Joint Position Sense)
description: The sense of the relative position of body parts and strength of effort being used in movement.
formula: $$\text{Measured by error in joint angle reproduction}$$

name: Vestibular System Function (Angular Acceleration Sensing)
description: Sensing of head angular acceleration by the semicircular canals.
formula: $$\text{Output related to angular acceleration, complex neurophysiology}$$

name: Visual Acuity (Snellen Fraction)
description: Measures the sharpness of vision.

name: Reaction Time (Simple)
description: Time taken to respond to a single, anticipated stimulus.

name: Reaction Time (Choice)
description: Time taken to respond to one of several possible stimuli.

name: Information Processing Rate (Hick's Law)
description: Relates reaction time to the number of choices.

name: Center of Pressure (COP) Velocity
description: Rate of change of the center of pressure, indicating postural sway.

name: Postural Stability Index (PSI)
description: Quantifies overall postural stability based on COP displacement.

name: Segmental Kinetic Energy (Biomechanics)
description: Kinetic energy of individual body segments during movement.

name: Total Body Kinetic Energy (Biomechanics)
description: Sum of kinetic energies of all body segments.

name: Total Body Potential Energy (Biomechanics)
description: Sum of gravitational potential energies of all body segments.

name: Mechanical Work (Positive/Concentric)
description: Work done by muscles during shortening (concentric contraction).

name: Mechanical Work (Negative/Eccentric)
description: Work done on muscles during lengthening (eccentric contraction).

name: Mechanical Power (Positive/Concentric)
description: Rate of work done by muscles during shortening.

name: Mechanical Power (Negative/Eccentric)
description: Rate of work done on muscles during lengthening.

name: Muscle Force-Length Relationship
description: Relationship between muscle length and the force it can produce.

name: Muscle Power-Velocity Relationship
description: Relationship between muscle power output and contraction velocity.

name: Elastic Modulus (Tendon/Ligament)
description: Stiffness of tendons and ligaments.

name: Ultimate Tensile Strength (Bone/Tissue)
description: Maximum stress a bone or tissue can withstand before failure.

name: Yield Strength (Bone/Tissue)
description: Stress at which bone or tissue begins to deform plastically.

name: Fracture Toughness (Bone)
description: Material's resistance to crack propagation.

name: Bone Remodeling Rate
description: Rate at which bone is broken down and rebuilt, influenced by mechanical loading.

name: Joint Kinematics (Euler Angles)
description: Describes 3D orientation of a joint using a sequence of three rotations.

name: Joint Kinetics (Inverse Dynamics)
description: Calculates joint forces and moments from kinematic data and external forces.
formula: $$\sum F = ma, \sum \tau = I\alpha$$ (applied segment by segment)

name: Segmental Mass and Inertia Properties
description: Mass, center of mass, and moment of inertia for individual body segments.

name: Aerodynamic Lift (Ski Jumping/Cycling)
description: Upward force generated by air flowing over an athlete or equipment.

name: Rolling Resistance (Cycling/Running)
description: Force opposing motion due to deformation of tires/shoes and ground.

name: Power Output (Cycling)
description: Mechanical power generated by a cyclist.

name: Swimming Propulsive Force (Simplified)
description: Force generated by a swimmer to move through water.
formula: $$F_p = \rho A v^2$$ (simplified, based on momentum change)

name: Swimming Drag Coefficient
description: Dimensionless coefficient quantifying resistance in swimming.

name: Thermal Regulation (Core Temperature Change)
description: Change in body core temperature due to heat balance.

name: Heat Index (Apparent Temperature)
description: Combines air temperature and relative humidity to estimate how hot it feels.

name: Wind Chill Index (Apparent Temperature)
description: Combines air temperature and wind speed to estimate how cold it feels.

name: Fluid Balance (Net Fluid Gain/Loss)
description: Difference between fluid intake and fluid output.

name: Dehydration Percentage
description: Percentage of body weight lost due to fluid deficit.
formula: $$\text{Dehydration %} = \frac{\text{Initial Body Mass} - \text{Final Body Mass}}{\text{Initial Body Mass}} \times 100\%$$

name: Blood Osmolality
description: Concentration of solutes in blood, influencing fluid shifts.

name: Renal Clearance
description: Volume of plasma cleared of a substance per unit time by the kidneys.

name: Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR)
description: Rate at which blood is filtered by the glomeruli in the kidneys.

name: Lung Volumes (Tidal Volume)
description: Volume of air inhaled or exhaled in a normal breath.

name: Lung Volumes (Vital Capacity)
description: Maximum volume of air that can be exhaled after a maximal inhalation.

name: Lung Volumes (Total Lung Capacity)
description: Total volume of air in the lungs after a maximal inhalation.

name: Airway Resistance
description: Resistance to airflow in the respiratory tract.

name: Pulmonary Compliance
description: Measure of the lung's ability to stretch and expand.

name: Oxygen Deficit (Exercise)
description: Difference between total oxygen consumed during exercise and what would have been consumed had steady-state been reached immediately.
formula: $$\text{Area under VO2 curve, no simple formula}$$

name: EPOC (Excess Post-exercise Oxygen Consumption)
description: Increased rate of oxygen intake following strenuous activity, to repay oxygen deficit.
formula: $$\text{Area under VO2 recovery curve, no simple formula}$$

name: Rate of Glycolysis
description: Rate of glucose breakdown for energy.

name: Rate of ATP Hydrolysis
description: Rate at which ATP is broken down to release energy for muscle contraction.

name: Muscle Fiber Conduction Velocity
description: Speed at which action potentials propagate along muscle fibers.
formula: $$\text{Measured by EMG techniques, no simple formula}$$

name: Motor Unit Firing Rate
description: Frequency at which a motor unit generates action potentials.
formula: $$\text{Measured by EMG techniques, no simple formula}$$

name: Neuromuscular Efficiency
description: Ratio of force output to EMG activity, indicating efficiency of neural drive.

name: Reflex Arc Latency
description: Time delay between stimulus and reflex response.

name: Sensory Receptor Threshold
description: Minimum stimulus intensity required to activate a sensory receptor.

name: Muscle Spindle Sensitivity
description: How responsive muscle spindles are to changes in muscle length and rate of change.

name: Golgi Tendon Organ (GTO) Threshold
description: Force threshold at which GTOs inhibit muscle contraction.

name: Visual Field (Degrees)
description: The extent of space visible to the eyes at any given moment.

name: Depth Perception (Stereoacuity)
description: Ability to perceive depth from binocular vision.

name: Auditory Threshold
description: Minimum sound intensity required for hearing.

name: Balance Confidence Scale (ABC Scale)
description: Self-reported measure of balance confidence.

name: Postural Sway Area
description: Area covered by the center of pressure during quiet standing.
formula: $$\text{Area of ellipse or polygon enclosing COP data}$$

name: Dynamic Stability Index (DSI)
description: Quantifies stability during dynamic tasks like walking or jumping.

name: Mechanical Power Absorption/Generation (Joint)
description: Rate at which a joint absorbs or generates mechanical energy.

name: Elastic Energy Storage (Tendon)
description: Energy stored in a tendon during stretching.

name: Power-to-Weight Ratio (Athlete)
description: Ratio of an athlete's power output to their body mass, crucial for climbing and acceleration.

name: Drag Coefficient (Running)
description: Quantifies air resistance in running.

name: Aerodynamic Power (Running/Cycling)
description: Power required to overcome air resistance.

name: Rolling Resistance Coefficient (Running Shoes)
description: Quantifies rolling friction for footwear.

name: Fluid Dynamic Efficiency (Swimming Stroke)
description: Ratio of propulsive power to total power expenditure in swimming.

name: Thermal Gradient (Skin to Core)
description: Temperature difference between skin and body core.

name: Sweat Rate
description: Rate of fluid loss through sweating.

name: Heat Acclimation Index
description: Measures the physiological adaptation to heat stress.
formula: $$\text{Various indices, e.g., decrease in heart rate or core temperature}$$

name: Muscle Glycogen Depletion Rate
description: Rate at which glycogen stores are used during exercise.

name: Fat Oxidation Rate
description: Rate at which fat is used as fuel during exercise.

name: Carbohydrate Oxidation Rate
description: Rate at which carbohydrates are used as fuel during exercise.

name: Respiratory Compensation Point (RCP)
description: Exercise intensity at which ventilation disproportionately increases to buffer acidosis.

name: Critical Power/Speed
description: The highest power/speed that can be maintained for a very long time without fatigue.

name: Work Capacity Above Critical Power (W')
description: Finite amount of work that can be performed above critical power.

name: Fatigue Resistance Index
description: Measure of an athlete's ability to resist fatigue during prolonged or intense exercise.
formula: $$\text{Various indices, e.g., percentage drop in power/force}$$

name: Recovery Rate (Heart Rate Recovery)
description: Rate at which heart rate decreases after exercise, indicating fitness.
formula: $$\text{Change in HR over specific post-exercise period}$$

name: Rate of Perceived Exertion (RPE) Training Load
description: Subjective training load calculated from RPE and duration.

name: Training Impulse (TRIMP) (Banister's Model)
description: Advanced training load model incorporating heart rate and duration.

name: Acute:Chronic Workload Ratio (ACWR)
description: Ratio of recent training load to long-term training load, used for injury risk management.

name: Muscle Damage Markers (Creatine Kinase)
description: Enzyme released into blood after muscle damage, indicating exercise-induced muscle damage (EIMD).
formula: $$\text{Measured by blood test, no simple formula}$$

name: Inflammatory Markers (Cytokines)
description: Proteins involved in inflammation, indicating physiological stress.
formula: $$\text{Measured by blood test, no simple formula}$$

name: Hormonal Response to Exercise (Cortisol/Testosterone Ratio)
description: Ratio used to assess anabolic/catabolic balance and overtraining risk.

name: Sleep Quality Index (PSQI)
description: Questionnaire-based assessment of sleep quality.

name: Nutrition (Energy Balance)
description: Difference between energy intake and energy expenditure.

name: Body Composition (Body Fat Percentage)
description: Percentage of total body mass that is fat.

name: Bone Stress Index (BSI)
description: Predicts bone stress based on load and geometry, used for stress fracture risk.

name: Joint Loading Rate
description: Rate at which force is applied to a joint.

name: Muscle Tendon Unit (MTU) Stiffness
description: Overall stiffness of the muscle and tendon in series.

name: Muscle Contraction Velocity (Maximum)
description: Maximum speed at which a muscle can shorten against zero load.

name: Muscle Isometric Force (Maximum)
description: Maximum force a muscle can produce at a given length without changing length.

name: Rate of Force Development (Time to Peak Force)
description: Time taken to reach peak force during a rapid contraction.

name: Muscle Relaxation Rate
description: Rate at which muscle force declines after contraction.

name: Propulsion Efficiency (Swimming)
description: Efficiency of converting muscular effort into forward motion in water.

name: Drag Power (Swimming/Cycling)
description: Power required to overcome fluid drag.

name: Metabolic Cost of Running
description: Energy expenditure per unit distance in running.

name: Thermal Conductivity (Biological Tissue)
description: Ability of biological tissue to conduct heat.

name: Specific Heat Capacity (Biological Tissue)
description: Amount of heat required to raise the temperature of biological tissue.

name: Blood Flow Regulation (Vasodilation/Vasoconstriction)
description: Changes in blood vessel diameter to regulate blood flow and heat exchange.

name: Sweat Gland Activity
description: Rate of sweat production by sweat glands.

name: Shivering Heat Production
description: Heat generated by involuntary muscle contractions in response to cold.

name: Non-shivering Thermogenesis (NST)
description: Heat production through metabolic processes in brown adipose tissue.

name: Cellular Respiration Efficiency
description: Efficiency of converting glucose energy into ATP.

name: ATP Production Rate
description: Rate at which ATP is synthesized through metabolic pathways.

name: Creatine Phosphate System (ATP Resynthesis)
description: Rapid ATP resynthesis via creatine phosphate.

name: Glycogenolysis Rate
description: Rate of glycogen breakdown into glucose.

name: Gluconeogenesis Rate
description: Rate of glucose synthesis from non-carbohydrate sources.

name: Lipolysis Rate
description: Rate of fat breakdown into fatty acids and glycerol.

name: Protein Degradation Rate
description: Rate at which proteins are broken down.

name: Protein Synthesis Rate
description: Rate at which new proteins are built.

name: Hormone Receptor Binding Affinity
description: Strength of binding between a hormone and its receptor.

name: Enzyme Kinetics (Michaelis-Menten)
description: Describes the rate of enzymatic reactions.

name: Cell Membrane Fluidity
description: Measure of the viscosity of the lipid bilayer, affecting protein movement and function.
formula: $$\text{Measured by fluorescence anisotropy, no simple formula}$$

name: Ion Channel Conductance
description: Measure of how easily ions flow through an ion channel.

name: Action Potential Refractory Period
description: Time during which a neuron or muscle cell cannot generate another action potential.

name: Synaptic Delay
description: Time taken for a signal to cross a synapse.

name: Neural Conduction Velocity
description: Speed at which electrical signals travel along a neuron.

name: Muscle Twitch Duration
description: Duration of a single muscle contraction in response to a single stimulus.

name: Muscle Summation and Tetanus
description: Increase in muscle force with increased stimulation frequency, leading to sustained contraction (tetanus).

name: Bone Elastic Strain Energy
description: Energy stored in bone due to elastic deformation.

name: Bone Viscoelastic Damping
description: Ability of bone to dissipate energy during deformation.
formula: $$\text{Measured by hysteresis loop area in stress-strain curve}$$

name: Joint Lubrication (Coefficient of Friction)
description: Friction between joint surfaces, reduced by synovial fluid.

name: Articular Cartilage Stiffness
description: Stiffness of cartilage in joints, influencing load distribution.

name: Impact Attenuation (Footwear/Surfaces)
description: Reduction of impact forces by cushioning materials.
formula: $$\text{Percentage reduction in peak force or loading rate}$$

name: Sport-Specific Power Output
description: Power generated in specific athletic movements (e.g., throwing, jumping, hitting).

name: Sport-Specific Efficiency
description: Efficiency of energy conversion for specific sports activities.
formula: $$\text{Ratio of useful work to total energy expenditure}$$

name: Spin Rate (Ball Sports)
description: Rate of rotation of a ball, influencing its trajectory.

name: Magnus Force (Ball Sports)
description: Force on a spinning object moving through a fluid, perpendicular to motion and spin axis.
formula: $$F_M = C_L \frac{1}{2}\rho A v^2$$ (simplified, where $C_L$ is lift coefficient due to spin)

name: Coefficient of Friction (Sport Surface)
description: Friction between footwear/equipment and playing surface.

name: Aerodynamic Profile (Athlete/Equipment)
description: Shape optimization for minimizing air resistance.

name: Hydrodynamic Profile (Swimmer/Equipment)
description: Shape optimization for minimizing water resistance.

name: Thermal Radiation Exchange (Athlete-Environment)
description: Net heat exchange via radiation between an athlete and their surroundings.

name: Convection Heat Exchange (Athlete-Environment)
description: Net heat exchange via convection between an athlete and surrounding air/water.

name: Evaporation Heat Exchange (Athlete)
description: Heat loss from an athlete due to sweat evaporation.

name: Total Heat Balance (Athlete)
description: Overall balance of heat production and loss in an athlete.

name: Core Temperature Regulation (Set Point Theory)
description: Body's physiological control of core temperature around a set point.

name: Thermoregulatory Sweat Rate
description: Sweat rate specifically for thermoregulation.
formula: $$\text{Dependent on heat load and environmental factors}$$

name: Blood Glucose Regulation
description: Homeostatic control of blood glucose levels by hormones like insulin and glucagon.

name: Glycemic Index (GI)
description: Measure of how quickly a food raises blood glucose levels.
formula: $$\text{GI} = \frac{\text{Area under blood glucose curve (test food)}}{\text{Area under blood glucose curve (reference food)}} \times 100$$

name: Glycemic Load (GL)
description: Quantifies the impact of carbohydrate portion size on blood glucose.

name: Protein Turnover Rate
description: Rate of protein synthesis and degradation in the body.

name: Fluid Compartment Volumes
description: Volumes of intracellular, interstitial, and plasma fluid compartments.

name: Electrolyte Balance
description: Homeostatic regulation of ion concentrations (e.g., Na+, K+, Cl-) in body fluids.

name: Acid-Base Balance (Henderson-Hasselbalch Equation)
description: Relates pH, bicarbonate, and carbonic acid in blood.

name: Respiratory Rate
description: Number of breaths per minute.

name: Tidal Volume
description: Volume of air inhaled or exhaled in a normal breath.

name: Alveolar Ventilation
description: Volume of fresh air reaching the alveoli per minute.

name: Dead Space Volume
description: Volume of air in the respiratory system that does not participate in gas exchange.

name: Pulmonary Gas Exchange (Fick's Law of Diffusion)
description: Rate of gas diffusion across the alveolar-capillary membrane.

name: Oxygen-Hemoglobin Dissociation Curve
description: Relationship between partial pressure of oxygen and hemoglobin saturation.

name: Myocardial Oxygen Consumption (MVO2)
description: Oxygen consumed by the heart muscle.

name: Ejection Fraction
description: Percentage of blood pumped out of the ventricle with each beat.

name: Stroke Volume (SV)
description: Volume of blood pumped out of the ventricle with each beat.

name: Peripheral Resistance (Total)
description: Total resistance to blood flow in the systemic circulation.

name: Blood Flow Velocity (Doppler Ultrasound)
description: Velocity of blood flow measured using Doppler effect.

name: Arterial Stiffness (Pulse Wave Velocity)
description: Measure of arterial stiffness based on how fast the pulse wave travels.

name: Blood Pressure (Pulse Pressure)
description: Difference between systolic and diastolic blood pressure.

name: Blood Pressure (Hydrostatic Component)
description: Component of blood pressure due to gravity in a vertical column of blood.

name: Capillary Exchange (Starling Forces)
description: Movement of fluid across capillary walls due to hydrostatic and oncotic pressures.

name: Lymph Flow Rate
description: Rate at which lymph fluid moves through the lymphatic system.

name: Fluid Shear Stress (Blood Vessels)
description: Frictional force exerted by blood flow on the vessel wall.

name: Vascular Resistance (Regional)
description: Resistance to blood flow in a specific vascular bed.

name: Cell Volume Regulation
description: Mechanisms by which cells maintain their volume despite osmotic challenges.

name: Membrane Potential (Action Potential Peak)
description: Maximum depolarization reached during an action potential.

name: Membrane Potential (Resting)
description: Stable, negative membrane potential of an excitable cell at rest.

name: Ion Channel Gating Kinetics
description: Rate at which ion channels open and close in response to stimuli.

name: Synaptic Strength (LTP/LTD)
description: Long-term potentiation (LTP) and long-term depression (LTD) of synaptic efficacy.

name: Neural Coding (Firing Rate)
description: Information encoded by the frequency of action potentials.

name: Neural Network Activity (Population Firing Rate)
description: Average firing rate of a population of neurons.

name: Muscle Force (Active Component)
description: Force generated by contractile elements of muscle.

name: Muscle Force (Passive Component)
description: Force generated by non-contractile elements (e.g., connective tissue) when muscle is stretched.

name: Muscle Stiffness (Passive)
description: Resistance of passive muscle to stretch.

name: Muscle Viscosity (Passive)
description: Resistance of passive muscle to rate of stretch.

name: Joint Range of Motion (ROM)
description: Full movement potential of a joint, measured in degrees.

name: Moment of Inertia (Segmental, about Joint)
description: Moment of inertia of a body segment about a specific joint axis.

name: Angular Momentum (Total Body)
description: Sum of angular momenta of all body segments.

name: Conservation of Angular Momentum (Sport)
description: Total angular momentum remains constant in the absence of external torques.

name: Impact Force (Peak)
description: Maximum force experienced during an impact event.

name: Impact Loading Rate
description: Rate at which impact force is applied.

name: Mechanical Energy Recovery (SSC)
description: Percentage of mechanical energy recovered in the stretch-shortening cycle.

name: Muscle Power (Peak)
description: Maximum power output of a muscle or muscle group.

name: Muscle Work (Total)
description: Total mechanical work done by a muscle during a movement.

name: Joint Stiffness (Linear)
description: Resistance of a joint to linear deformation.

name: Viscoelasticity (Hysteresis Loss)
description: Energy dissipated as heat during cyclic loading of viscoelastic tissue.
formula: $$\text{Area of hysteresis loop in stress-strain curve}$$

name: Bone Strain Rate
description: Rate of deformation of bone tissue.

name: Wolff's Law (Bone Remodeling)
description: Bone adapts its structure to the loads it is subjected to.

name: Joint Reaction Force (3D Components)
description: Components of the joint reaction force in three dimensions (X, Y, Z).

name: Joint Moment (3D Components)
description: Components of the joint moment in three dimensions (X, Y, Z).

name: Ground Reaction Force (Vertical Component)
description: Vertical component of the force exerted by the ground, crucial for jumping and landing.

name: Ground Reaction Force (Anterior-Posterior Component)
description: Force component along the direction of motion, related to propulsion and braking.

name: Ground Reaction Force (Medial-Lateral Component)
description: Force component perpendicular to the direction of motion, related to stability.

name: Center of Pressure (COP) Trajectory
description: Path traced by the center of pressure during movement or standing.

name: Aerodynamic Drag (Cycling Position Optimization)
description: Minimizing drag by optimizing body position and equipment.

name: Hydrodynamic Drag (Swimming Stroke Efficiency)
description: Minimizing drag by optimizing swimming technique.

name: Rolling Resistance (Tire Pressure)
description: Influence of tire pressure on rolling resistance.
formula: $$\text{Empirical relationship, generally lower pressure = higher resistance}$$

name: Power Balance (Athlete)
description: Balance between power generated and power dissipated (e.g., in cycling).

name: Thermal Sensation Vote (TSV)
description: Subjective rating of thermal comfort on a scale.

name: Sweat Evaporation Rate (Maximum)
description: Maximum rate at which sweat can evaporate from the skin.

name: Heat Storage in Body
description: Net heat accumulated in the body, leading to temperature change.

name: Dehydration Impact on Performance
description: Relationship between dehydration level and decline in exercise performance.
formula: $$\text{Empirical relationship, typically a percentage decrease in performance per % dehydration}$$

name: Glycogen Resynthesis Rate
description: Rate at which muscle and liver glycogen stores are replenished after exercise.
formula: $$\text{Dependent on carbohydrate intake and insulin sensitivity}$$

name: Protein Synthesis (Post-Exercise)
description: Increased rate of protein synthesis after exercise, crucial for muscle repair and growth.

name: Hormonal Balance (Anabolic/Catabolic)
description: Balance between hormones promoting tissue building (anabolic) and tissue breakdown (catabolic).
formula: $$\text{Ratio of anabolic to catabolic hormones (e.g., T/C ratio)}$$

name: Sleep Duration (Optimal for Performance)
description: Recommended hours of sleep for optimal athletic performance and recovery.

name: Recovery Strategies (Impact on Performance)
description: Effectiveness of various recovery methods (e.g., cold water immersion, massage) on subsequent performance.

name: Training Periodization (Macrocycle/Mesocycle/Microcycle)
description: Systematic planning of training to optimize performance and minimize overtraining.

name: Overload Principle (Training Adaptation)
description: To improve, the body must be subjected to loads greater than accustomed to.

name: Specificity Principle (Training Adaptation)
description: Training adaptations are specific to the type of exercise performed.

name: Reversibility Principle (Detraining)
description: Physiological adaptations to training are lost when training ceases.

name: Individualization Principle (Training)
description: Training programs should be tailored to individual needs and responses.

name: Progressive Overload (Training)
description: Gradually increasing training stress over time to continue adaptation.

name: Force-Time Curve (Muscle Contraction)
description: Plot of force generated by a muscle over time during a contraction.

name: Power-Time Curve (Muscle Contraction)
description: Plot of power generated by a muscle over time during a contraction.

name: Work-Time Curve (Muscle Contraction)
description: Plot of total work done by a muscle over time during a contraction.

name: Fatigue Threshold (EMG Median Frequency)
description: Frequency at which EMG median frequency starts to decline, indicating fatigue.

name: Muscle Fiber Recruitment (Size Principle)
description: Orderly recruitment of motor units from smallest to largest with increasing force.

name: Motor Unit Conduction Velocity
description: Speed of action potential propagation along the motor unit.

name: Joint Reaction Force (Magnitude)
description: Overall magnitude of the force exerted across a joint.

name: Joint Moment (Magnitude)
description: Overall magnitude of the moment acting across a joint.

name: Ground Reaction Force (Resultant Vector)
description: Vector sum of all ground reaction force components.

name: Center of Mass (COM) Trajectory
description: Path traced by the body's center of mass during movement.

name: Center of Mass (COM) Velocity
description: Velocity of the body's center of mass.

name: Center of Mass (COM) Acceleration
description: Acceleration of the body's center of mass.

name: Impulse-Momentum Theorem (Sport-Specific)
description: Relates impulse from ground contact to change in body momentum during a jump or sprint.

name: Angular Impulse-Momentum Theorem (Sport-Specific)
description: Relates angular impulse from torques to change in body angular momentum during a spin or rotation.

name: Work-Energy Principle (Sport-Specific)
description: Net work done by external forces equals change in total mechanical energy of the athlete.

name: Mechanical Efficiency (Sport)
description: Ratio of mechanical work output to metabolic energy expenditure during exercise.

name: Economy of Movement (General)
description: Metabolic energy cost to perform a given amount of mechanical work or cover a given distance.

name: Aerodynamic Drag Coefficient (Athlete)
description: Dimensionless coefficient for an athlete's body shape, influencing air resistance.

name: Frontal Area (Athlete)
description: Area projected by an athlete's body perpendicular to the direction of motion, influencing air resistance.

name: Rolling Resistance Coefficient (Sports Equipment)
description: Quantifies friction for wheels/balls on a surface.

name: Coefficient of Friction (Athlete-Surface)
description: Friction between athlete's footwear and playing surface, crucial for traction.

name: Impact Force (Peak, Foot-Ground)
description: Maximum force experienced by the foot upon ground contact during running/walking.

name: Loading Rate (Foot-Ground Impact)
description: Rate at which force increases during foot-ground impact.

name: Stress Shielding (Bone)
description: Reduction in bone density due to reduced mechanical loading, often seen with implants.

name: Bone Fatigue Life
description: Number of loading cycles bone can withstand before fatigue failure.

name: Articular Cartilage Contact Stress
description: Stress experienced by joint cartilage under load.

name: Ligament/Tendon Force
description: Force transmitted through a ligament or tendon.

name: Muscle Activation Level
description: Fraction of a muscle's maximum contractile capacity that is activated.

name: Motor Control (Feedback Loop)
description: System where sensory information is used to adjust motor output.

name: Motor Control (Feedforward Control)
description: Anticipatory motor adjustments based on prior experience or prediction.

name: Proprioceptive Acuity
description: Precision of proprioceptive sense.
formula: $$\text{Measured by error in joint angle matching}$$

name: Vestibulo-Ocular Reflex (VOR) Gain
description: Ratio of eye movement velocity to head movement velocity during head rotation.

name: Visual Field (Peripheral)
description: Extent of vision outside the central foveal area.

name: Visual Processing Speed
description: Speed at which visual information is processed by the brain.
formula: $$\text{Measured by reaction time to visual stimuli}$$

name: Auditory Localization (Interaural Time Difference)
description: Difference in arrival time of sound at each ear, used for sound localization.

name: Auditory Localization (Interaural Level Difference)
description: Difference in sound intensity at each ear, used for sound localization.

name: Tactile Sensitivity (Two-Point Discrimination)
description: Minimum distance at which two points can be perceived as separate.

name: Balance (Limits of Stability)
description: Maximum range of motion in the anteroposterior and mediolateral directions without losing balance.

name: Postural Control (Feedback Loop)
description: System where sensory inputs (visual, vestibular, somatosensory) are used to maintain balance.

name: Postural Control (Feedforward Mechanism)
description: Anticipatory adjustments to maintain balance during planned movements.

name: Energy Expenditure (Resting Metabolic Rate)
description: Energy expended by the body at rest to maintain vital functions.
formula: $$\text{Measured by indirect calorimetry or predictive equations}$$

name: Energy Expenditure (Exercise)
description: Energy expended during physical activity.

name: Total Daily Energy Expenditure (TDEE)
description: Total energy expended by the body in a 24-hour period.

name: Thermic Effect of Food (TEF)
description: Energy expended for digestion, absorption, and metabolism of food.

name: Non-Exercise Activity Thermogenesis (NEAT)
description: Energy expended for all activities not related to sleeping, eating, or planned exercise.

name: Exercise Activity Thermogenesis (EAT)
description: Energy expended during planned physical exercise.

name: Body Mass Index (BMI)
description: A measure of body fat based on height and weight.

name: Waist-to-Hip Ratio (WHR)
description: Ratio of waist circumference to hip circumference, indicating fat distribution.

name: Body Surface Area (BSA)
description: Total surface area of the human body, relevant for heat exchange and drug dosage.
formula: $$\text{Various formulas, e.g., Du Bois formula: } BSA = 0.007184 \times W^{0.425} \times H^{0.725}$$

name: Bone Strength Index (BSI)
description: Composite index reflecting bone strength, combining BMD and structural properties.

name: Bone Elastic Modulus (Apparent)
description: Overall stiffness of bone at the macroscopic level.

name: Bone Anisotropy
description: Directional dependence of bone's mechanical properties.

name: Cartilage Permeability
description: Ease with which fluid flows through articular cartilage, influencing load support.

name: Synovial Fluid Viscosity
description: Viscosity of joint fluid, providing lubrication.

name: Ligament/Tendon Creep
description: Time-dependent increase in length of ligament/tendon under constant load.

name: Ligament/Tendon Stress Relaxation
description: Time-dependent decrease in stress in ligament/tendon held at constant length.

name: Muscle Force-Time Integral
description: Total impulse generated by a muscle contraction.

name: Muscle Power-Time Integral
description: Total work done by a muscle contraction.

name: Joint Work (Total)
description: Total mechanical work done across a joint during movement.

name: Joint Efficiency
description: Efficiency of energy transfer across a joint.

name: Segmental Angular Momentum
description: Angular momentum of an individual body segment.

name: Total Body Angular Momentum
description: Sum of angular momenta of all body segments, conserved in flight.

name: Moment of Inertia (Whole Body)
description: Overall rotational inertia of the human body, adjustable by posture.

name: Rotational Kinetic Energy (Whole Body)
description: Kinetic energy due to the rotation of the entire body.

name: Impact Force (Ground Reaction Force Peak)
description: Maximum vertical ground reaction force during landing or striking.

name: Impact Duration
description: Time over which an impact force is applied.

name: Impact Attenuation (Material Properties)
description: Ability of a material (e.g., in footwear) to reduce impact forces.

name: Stress-Strain Curve (Biological Tissue)
description: Relationship between stress and strain for biological tissues (e.g., bone, tendon, cartilage).

name: Ultimate Strain (Biological Tissue)
description: Strain at which biological tissue fails.

name: Energy Stored (Biological Tissue)
description: Energy stored in biological tissue during elastic deformation.

name: Aerodynamic Drag (Form Drag)
description: Drag due to the shape of an object moving through a fluid.

name: Aerodynamic Drag (Skin Friction Drag)
description: Drag due to friction between the fluid and the surface of the object.

name: Aerodynamic Lift-to-Drag Ratio
description: Efficiency of an aerodynamic body, ratio of lift to drag.

name: Hydrodynamic Drag (Pressure Drag)
description: Drag due to pressure differences around a body moving through water.

name: Hydrodynamic Drag (Friction Drag)
description: Drag due to friction between water and the surface of a body.

name: Hydrodynamic Drag (Wave Drag)
description: Drag due to the generation of waves by a body moving at the water surface.

name: Rolling Resistance (Slope Impact)
description: Additional force due to rolling up or down a slope.

name: Power-to-CdA Ratio (Cycling)
description: Metric for aerodynamic efficiency in cycling.

name: Thermal Comfort (Mean Radiant Temperature)
description: Uniform temperature of a black enclosure that would result in the same radiant heat exchange as the actual non-uniform environment.

name: Thermal Comfort (Air Velocity)
description: Speed of air movement, influencing convective heat exchange.

name: Thermal Comfort (Clothing Insulation)
description: Resistance of clothing to heat transfer.

name: Thermal Comfort (Metabolic Rate)
description: Heat production rate by the body, influencing thermal comfort.

name: Heat Stress Index (Wet Bulb Globe Temperature - WBGT)
description: Composite temperature used to estimate heat stress in direct sunlight.

name: Heat Acclimation (Sweat Onset Time)
description: Time taken for sweating to begin in response to heat stress, decreases with acclimation.

name: Heat Acclimation (Sweat Rate Increase)
description: Increase in sweat rate with heat acclimation.

name: Fluid Replacement Rate (Exercise)
description: Rate at which fluids should be consumed during exercise to match sweat loss.

name: Carbohydrate Intake (Exercise)
description: Recommended carbohydrate intake during prolonged exercise to maintain performance.

name: Protein Intake (Recovery)
description: Recommended protein intake after exercise for muscle repair and growth.

name: Fat Intake (General Nutrition)
description: Recommended fat intake as a percentage of total daily energy intake.

name: Vitamin D Status
description: Blood level of 25-hydroxyvitamin D, important for bone health and immune function.

name: Iron Status (Ferritin)
description: Blood ferritin levels, indicating iron stores, crucial for oxygen transport.

name: Sleep Efficiency
description: Ratio of total sleep time to time in bed.

name: Sleep Latency
description: Time taken to fall asleep.

name: Wake After Sleep Onset (WASO)
description: Total time spent awake after initially falling asleep.

name: Total Sleep Time (TST)
description: Total duration of sleep.

name: Sleep Debt
description: Accumulated difference between required sleep and actual sleep.

name: Training Monotony
description: Measure of the day-to-day variability in training load.
formula: $$\text{Monotony} = \frac{\text{Mean Daily Load}}{\text{Standard Deviation of Daily Load}}$$

name: Training Strain
description: Overall physiological stress from training, combining load and monotony.

name: Fitness-Fatigue Model (Training Adaptation)
description: Models how training stimulus affects fitness and fatigue, influencing performance.

name: Tapering Strategy (Performance Optimization)
description: Reduction in training load before competition to optimize performance.

name: Peak Power (Wingate Test)
description: Maximum power output during a short, maximal cycling sprint.

name: Mean Power (Wingate Test)
description: Average power output during a Wingate test.

name: Fatigue Index (Wingate Test)
description: Percentage decline in power from peak to minimum during a Wingate test.

name: Isokinetic Strength (Peak Torque)
description: Maximum torque generated at a constant angular velocity.

name: Isokinetic Power
description: Power generated during isokinetic contraction.

name: Electromechanical Delay (EMD)
description: Time delay between muscle electrical activation (EMG onset) and mechanical force production (force onset).
